intro: Seseli resinosum, commonly known as the resinous seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous, and the plant is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils. Seseli resinosum is often found in alpine and steppe environments, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions.
